titleStmt.title: No love, no life. Or, Damon comforted in distress. You that are adorn'd with beauty, did not thus your love disdain; count not it to be their duty, for to languish thus in pain. To the tune of, Tender hearts of London city.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Deacon in Guilt-spur-street.,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "Damon in the shades was walking ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
